column2: RHODE ISLAND DMV TEST
column4: Rhode Island

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. When a school bus is stopped with its red lights flashing:
column4: drivers don't need to stop unless they are in a school zone.
column6: drivers only need to stop if children are present.
column10: drivers may not pass while the red lights are flashing.

column2: 2. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: slow down and keep moving in your lane.
column6: speed up and take the nearest exit.
column10: pull to the curb and stop.

column2: 3. You are coming to an intersection and have a green light. Pedestrians are crossing against the red. You should:
column4: claim your right-of-way and proceed with caution.
column6: speed up and pass in front of the pedestrians.
column8: stop to let pedestrians cross safely.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: This lane is reserved for bicyclists

column2: 5. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column6: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column8: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column10: stop, look right, then left, then right again.

column2: 6. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column6: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column8: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column10: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.

column2: 7. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column6: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column8: the first rain after a dry spell.

column2: 8. When a driver has their left arm and hand extended upward, the driver plans to:
column4: go straight ahead.

column2: 9. Drivers must not drive at:
column4: a speed that is not prudent for the circumstances.
column6: a speed that is greater than the posted speed limit.
column8: a speed that is greater than reasonable.

column2: 10. When approaching a railroad crossing that has no warning signals (such as electric flashing lights or gates) a driver should look, listen and slow down.
column4: False

column2: 11. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line

column2: 12. Broken white lines can be crossed over:
column4: when it is safe to change lanes.

column2: 13. Sudden wind gusts on highways:
column4: are generally caused by dust and dirt blowing around.
column6: can cause one to lose control of their vehicle.

column2: 14. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 15. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: not drive faster than 25 MPH.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 16. This traffic sign warns you about:
column4: a winding road.
column10: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: T-intersection ahead

column2: 18. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
column4: a yield sign.

column2: 19. When a pedestrian carrying a white cane is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you, before making your right turn, you should:
column4: tell the pedestrian where to cross the street.
column6: turn off the ignition until the person crosses the street.
column8: yield the right-of-way and wait until the pedestrian crosses the street.
column10: use your horn to help the pedestrian cross the street.

column2: 20. Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
column4: before midnight.

column2: 21. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a low place in the road.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 22. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column10: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles

column2: 24. Drivers should not sound their horn when:
column4: visibility ahead is limited.

column2: 25. _____________ lights indicate that drivers should slow down and proceed with caution at an intersection.
column4: Flashing yellow
